title: WCAS INTL_ST 390-0-20 Special Topics in International Studies

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: At the end of the quarter, students should have a strong empirical grasp on the continent's diversity of political experiences and be able to articulate prominent theoretical explanations to explain these trajectories. Students should leave the course able to apply a series of theories and frameworks to explain contemporary political issues in African politics.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: In-class quizzes, midterm, take-home final, in-class presentation

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Course Reader
van de Walle, Nic. 2001. African Economies and the Politics of Permanent Crisis, 1979-99. New York: Cambridge University Press

subject: INTL_ST
